title: Upbeat EasyJet boosted by strikes at rival airlines
text:
EasyJet expects to hit the upper end of its forecast full-year profit range after a "solid performance" in its fourth quarter, helped by strikes at rivals British Airways and Ryanair.

The company said it expected to report headline profit before tax of between £420m and £430m.

The budget airline boosted passenger numbers by 8.6pc to 96 million after increasing its capacity by 10.3pc to 105 million seats. However load factor - the proportion of available seats sold - will fall 1.4 percentage points to 91.5pc for the full year, easyJet said.

Johan Lundgren, easyJet's chief executive, said his airline had "continued to perform in line with expectations, despite challenging market conditions". ...
description: EasyJet expects to hit the upper end of its forecast full-year profit range after a "solid performance" in its fourth quarter, helped by strikes at rivals British Airways and Ryanair.
